phase: Phase 1 - End-to-end Live Public Trades Feed

tech_stack.frontend: React + Vite + Tailwind CSS (npm for package management)

milestone_1.goal: Initialize project with skeleton structure, dependencies, and init.sh script

steps.instruction: Create root project directory structure with backend/ and frontend/ folders
Set up backend Python project structure with src/ layout using uv init
Initialize React frontend project using Vite with Tailwind CSS configured via npm
Add backend dependencies using uv including Starlette, uvicorn, websockets, sqlite3, cryptography
commands: uv add starlette uvicorn websockets cryptography pydantic
steps.acceptance_criteria: pyproject.toml includes all necessary packages for RSA-based Kalshi auth and WebSocket handling (cryptography for RSA signing)

steps.instruction: Create init.sh script that installs all dependencies and starts both backend and frontend
script_commands: cd frontend && npm install (using npm for frontend dependencies)
cd frontend && npm run dev & (start frontend)
steps.acceptance_criteria: Script successfully installs backend deps using uv, frontend deps using npm, starts backend on port 8000 and frontend on port 3000

steps.instruction: Create environment configuration with .env.example for Kalshi RSA authentication credentials
Create basic Starlette app entry point with health check endpoint
steps.acceptance_criteria: App starts successfully with uv run and responds to GET /health with 200 status

milestone_2.goal: Implement Kalshi WebSocket client with RSA auth to subscribe to public trades

steps.instruction: Create data models for Kalshi trade messages using Pydantic
steps.acceptance_criteria: Models validate incoming Kalshi trade JSON payloads correctly

steps.instruction: Implement RSA signature authentication for Kalshi API using private key file

auth_details.mechanism: RSA private key signing with PSS padding and SHA256
required_env: KALSHI_PRIVATE_KEY_PATH (path to RSA private key file)
auth_details.signature_process: timestamp_ms + method + path -> sign with private key -> base64 encode

steps.instruction: Create KalshiWebSocketClient class with connection and authentication logic
steps.acceptance_criteria: Client can connect to Kalshi WebSocket and authenticate using RSA signature successfully

steps.instruction: Implement reconnection logic with exponential backoff for WebSocket failures
steps.acceptance_criteria: Client automatically reconnects after network failures with proper delays

steps.instruction: Add subscription to public trades channel and message parsing
steps.acceptance_criteria: Client subscribes to trades channel and parses incoming trade messages into Trade objects

steps.instruction: Create standalone script to test Kalshi client functionality
steps.acceptance_criteria: Script connects, authenticates, subscribes, and prints trade messages to stdout when run with uv

steps.instruction: Write unit tests for Kalshi client authentication and message parsing
test_coverage: RSA signature generation with private key file

milestone_3.goal: Integrate Kalshi client with Starlette backend for real-time trade processing

steps.instruction: Create SQLite database schema for trades storage
tables: trades (id, market_ticker, yes_price, no_price, yes_price_dollars, no_price_dollars, count, taker_side, ts, received_at)

steps.instruction: Implement in-memory trade aggregation and ticker state management
Create trade processor service that handles incoming trades from Kalshi client
Implement WebSocket broadcaster for frontend real-time updates
Integrate Kalshi client as background task in Starlette app startup
key_integration_points: Start Kalshi client on app startup
steps.acceptance_criteria: Backend starts, connects to Kalshi, and processes trades while serving WebSocket endpoint

steps.instruction: Add optional HTTP API endpoints for debugging and initial data
steps.acceptance_criteria: API endpoints return JSON data matching WebSocket message format

steps.instruction: Test complete backend integration with mock trade data
test_scenarios: Mock trades flow through system correctly

milestone_4.goal: Implement frontend layout and real-time trade feed

steps.instruction: Create main app layout with header and two-column responsive design
Implement WebSocket connection hook for real-time data
Create TradeTape component for left panel live trade feed
Create HotMarkets component for right panel volume-based ranking
Implement simple SVG sparkline component for price visualization
Create ticker detail drawer for expanded view
Integrate all components with real-time data state management
Add responsive design and basic error handling for WebSocket disconnections
steps.acceptance_criteria: Frontend displays live trades and hot markets with real-time updates from backend

steps.instruction: Test complete end-to-end flow with backend integration
test_scenarios: Updates real-time as trades come in
steps.acceptance_criteria: Complete working application showing live Kalshi trades in real-time

key_results.real_time_updates: PASS - Live Kalshi market data flowing through UI

puppeteer_validation.summary: Milestone 4 successfully completed - Beautiful responsive frontend with real-time trade feed working excellently. Application shows live Kalshi market data with professional UI design.

milestone_5.goal: Beautiful UX layout reorganization with hero stats, market grid, and improved live feed placement

steps.instruction: Create HeroStats component for global aggregate statistics at the top
features: Total trades count (implement first using existing data)
Total volume placeholder card (empty for now)
Total net flow placeholder card (empty for now)
Beautiful card-based layout with animated counters
Responsive design for mobile and desktop
technical_notes: Use existing recentTrades.length for trades count
Style with Tailwind CSS for visual appeal
Add subtle animations for data updates
Leave volume and net flow as 'Coming Soon' placeholders
steps.acceptance_criteria: Hero section displays total trades count with beautiful styling and updates in real-time

steps.instruction: Create MarketGrid component to replace sidebar hot markets with beautiful card grid
features: Grid layout of market cards (responsive columns)
Each card shows ticker, last price, volume, flow direction
Click handler to open detailed view (preserve existing functionality)
design_requirements: Cards should feel alive with data flowing
Use color coding for YES/NO flow direction
Responsive grid (4 cols desktop, 2 cols tablet, 1 col mobile)
steps.acceptance_criteria: Grid displays hot markets as beautiful cards with preserved functionality and improved visual appeal

steps.instruction: Reorganize main layout to position live feed at bottom with reduced visual priority
layout_changes: Market grid in middle (main focus area)
Live trade feed moved to bottom
Reduce trade feed height and visual prominence
Maintain scrolling functionality for trade feed
visual_changes: Reduce trade feed font size slightly
Use muted colors for trade feed to reduce visual weight
steps.acceptance_criteria: Layout flows from hero stats to market grid to trade feed with improved visual hierarchy

steps.instruction: Update App.jsx to integrate new layout structure and component hierarchy
integration_tasks: Update layout structure in main render
Ensure data props flow correctly to new components
Preserve existing state management and WebSocket connectivity
Remove old two-column layout CSS if no longer needed
data_flow: HeroStats receives aggregate data for trades count
TradeTape receives recentTrades array (moved to bottom)
steps.acceptance_criteria: App renders new layout with all components properly integrated and data flowing correctly

steps.instruction: Fix WebSocket error appearing in console logs
error_investigation: Check WebSocket connection cleanup on component unmount
Verify reconnection logic doesn't create multiple connections
Ensure proper error handling for connection failures
Add better error logging to identify root cause
fixes_to_implement: Proper WebSocket cleanup in useEffect cleanup function
Add connection state guards to prevent double connections
steps.acceptance_criteria: No WebSocket errors appear in browser console and connection remains stable

steps.instruction: Apply beautiful responsive design polish and animations throughout
design_enhancements: Add subtle animations for data updates
Add loading states with skeleton components
Ensure accessibility with proper contrast ratios
responsive_requirements: Mobile: Single column layout with stacked components
Tablet: 2-column grid for markets, responsive hero stats
Desktop: Full grid layout with optimal spacing
Test on various screen sizes for visual consistency
animation_details: Fade-in effects for new trade items
steps.acceptance_criteria: Application feels polished and engaging across all device sizes with smooth animations

steps.instruction: Test complete UX reorganization and verify all functionality preserved
test_scenarios: Hero stats display and update correctly
Market grid shows all hot markets with preserved functionality
Clicking market cards opens detailed view (existing functionality)
Live trade feed continues to update in real-time at bottom
Responsive design works across mobile, tablet, desktop
Smooth animations and transitions work properly
Performance remains good with hundreds of trades
steps.acceptance_criteria: All existing functionality preserved with significantly improved UX and no console errors
manual_testing: Verify visual appeal and data flow feeling
Confirm WebSocket stability over extended period
